p: When comparing the results from other studies that also evaluated the antioxidant profile of Brazilian propolis, the current study found higher phenolic concentrations (approximately 4-fold, sample B) than those reported in the studies by Cottica al. [ 83] and Mello et al. [ 84], which found values ranging from 48 to 87 mgGAE.g -1 and 49 to 100 mgGAE.g -1, respectively.
